author: Melo
text: I'm not the traditional author. I write in a prose format, none of my books are on Amazon, I do every single aspect of my book on my own, I record my own audiobooks and put them on Payhip, have a podcast on my journey, it's safe to say I've broken all of the rules #AuthorLife

author: Melo
text: I wonder how many authors and writers have so many notes in their phone of ideas and concepts that they can't keep track. I know there's a lot for me! #writerscommunity

author: Melo
text: The one thing I can say about my journey as an author is, I feel I was called to do this. This was somehow destined to be my life path. There are so many social issues I can write about (some I'll never touch) but people's stories and the world around me inspire me to write.

author: Melo
text:
Formatting: Fiverr (most charge by word count and pages)
Marketing: Written Word Media
Book Reviews: Booksprout (monthly subscription), KDPpromotions (Amazon only)

Press releases are also a good route. And definitely utilizing your local bookstore! (It's helped me immensely)

author: Melo
text:
For authors who want to self-publish

Writing the book: Google Docs or Microsoft Word 
Editing: Do it yourself or utilize Fiverr
Book Covers: Canva you can make it yourself or Fiverr (affordable)
Formatting: Streetlib (do it yourself, Italian company)

author: Melo
text: The start of a new month. New opportunities, a chance to grow, work toward your goals, speak positivity into your mind, we can do this! Let's get it! 🙌🏽 🙏🏽 💯 😀

author: Melo
text: You all deserve the best in life. To pursue your love and passion, be happy, healthy and heal from all that you've dealt with. Don't doubt yourself and who you are, love yourself and be patient in the process of growth...🙏🏽

author: Melo
text: Experiences in my life will always have me in deep thought and constantly dropping gems. Those previous tweets are just things I've learned about myself and others along the way. Getting older and wiser isn't necessarily a bad thing after all...

author: Melo
text: The most sacred parts of our inner being and souls should be saved for those who value and cherish those things. It's just hard to decide who to give that to and know the trust will always be there.

author: Melo
text: The ones with the biggest hearts and beautiful souls get hurt the most sadly. It's because they wear their heart on their sleeves and are the 'benefit of the doubt' types. When they finally get their blessings, they're unsure or scared. Be patient, give them reassurance be kind.

author: Melo
text: All of our struggles, disappointments, sadness, tears, pain, sorrow all lead to this present moment. The hard parts of our lives lead to our blessings. Loving ourselves all over again, finding our truths. It's hard to let go of what was but it's great to know what will be....

author: Melo
text: Tweet 4 it's supposed to be bumps in the road

author: Melo
text: I don't love myself all of the time and I have flaws (overthinking, overanalyzing, doubting my talents, self-sabotage, beating myself up for mistakes) but I'm growing and getting better daily. I don't strive for perfection, I strive for growth because life is a marathon.

author: Melo
text: It's why I write poems about life that I mostly share on IG. What I'm saying is, your journey will have humps in the road and your past will be on your mind but your past keeps you from living in the moment and having blessings come your way in the future.

author: Melo
text: It's just been me and God on this journey and I'm valuing patience, love, compassion and empathy these days. I think about a lot of things in my life that I want to experience and I pray that I do. I try not to paint a perfect life on social media.

author: Melo
text: I struggle with my thoughts and I only share the things I do because of my experiences and what I've been through. From depression and therapy to being where I am now, I've come a long way. It's lonely at times with no family or friends here but I manage.

author: Melo
text: When I was younger, the day I graduated college, I knew I wouldn't live in NY for the long haul and I'd always end up on the west coast and here I am. Maybe I didn't realize I was manifesting something at 22 that by the end of my 30s it would come to fruition.

author: Melo
text: The one thing I can say, I've come a long way. I count my blessings and tell those I care about how I feel daily. I don't know what tomorrow will bring so it's why I do it as much as possible.
